name: hack-the-hub.github.io
tagline: Working together for a better Northern Ireland
body:
### #HackTheHub
Hack The Hub is a 12 hour hackathon hosted by Nigma and [Women Who Code](https://www.womenwhocode.com/). With the theme of "Making Northern Ireland Better" we want to see what women coders and the student developer community can come up with to provide a solution that solves some of the real-world problems that NI faces today.

### Who Should Enter?
Anyone that is studying/studied a computing related degree. All Genders Welcome. All experience levels, all roles within tech (Hackathons need UX, Testers, Coders, BAs).

Entrants can either enter individually and be placed into a team or register a team of up to 5 members.

### Prizes
The hackathon gives 12 hours for contestants to create, build and hack to- gether solutions for making Northern Ireland better. They will then demo their prototype to some well-known and distinguished figures within the community (TBA) and will have the chance to walk away with a cash prize! Oh, and there'll be lots of spot prizes and goodies up for grabs and swag bags for all attendees!

* 1st Prize: £1000
* 2nd Prize: £750  
* 3rd Prize: £500
Other prizes include: Apple Watches, Drones, Bose Head-phones, Go Pros etc.

### Venue
Date: Sat 10th September 2016
Time: 09:00 - 22:00
Address: 
PwC Google Innovation Lab
Waterfront Plaza, 
8 Laganbank Rd, 
Belfast BT1 3LR

### Rules
The rules are simple and only exist to ensure everyone has a fair chance of winning the competition.

1. No code should be prepared prior to the event 
Everyone starts fresh on Saturday.
2. Open source libaries, frameworks, APIs are welcome 
Everyone should have access to the same resources for free
3. Open source your project to share the knowledge
Sharing is caring. The IP of your project remains with you, but once coding ends we would like everyone to share what they have created with the community.
